bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, December 1, 1914

div1.p: Carter writes to his wife regarding travel details and the weather.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, December 1, 1914
div1.opener:
THE NEW
HOTEL MORRIS
EUROPEAN
MANAGEMENT
SCOVILLE BROS. PROPRIETORS.
ALSO OWNERS AND OPERATORS OF “THE WIGWAM,” INDIAN SPRINGS, GA.
Birmingham, Ala.,
Dec 1/14 (night)
Dear Laura:
div1.p:
I leave tomorrow for the Pond,
somewhere near Montgomery - above it.
Expect to go to New Orleans to see von Ez-
dorf & Le Prince. Thursday evening
so as to get there Friday morning
Leave N. O. Friday evening - 8. P. M.
for that place which I will reach
Saturday morning. Leave
Birmingham for Baltimore
Saturday night & get in Monday
about noon. If I stop in Washing-
ton- possible, but I think not
likely as I will be too tired
to do any business by that
time I will be home a few
hours later.

This is longer than I expec-
ted, by two days, but I can't
well help it. I will come back
as soon as I can.

I earnestly hope that you are feel-
ing well my dear, & I wish you had
the warmer weather we are hav-
ing here - only it was raining
all day yesterday - almost
to Atlanta.

Will you please write Laura
a card as soon as you get this
& tell her that I am sure than
Dr Anderson
Dr Anderson is in Jacksonville at
the Public Health Association.
div1.closer:
Your affectionate husband H. R. Carter Not much worth while to write to me
as I am too short a time at one place.
but if advisable to do so
my address will be Care
Alabama Power Company
Birmingham
H. R. C.
